Sṛ
Delany reports, and he has a shrewd Tongue
That We both Act the Parts, of the Clowns and the Cow dung,
We lye cramming our selves and are ready to burst,
Yet still are no wiser than We were at first.
Pudet hæc Opprobria I freely must tell You
Et dici potuisse et non potuisse refelli.
Tho' Delany advis'd You to plague me longer
You Reply and rejoyn like Hoadly of Bangor
I must now att one sitting pay off my old score.
How many to Answer? here's One, Two, Three, Four.
But because the Three former are long ago past
I shall for Method's sake begin with the last.
You treat me like a Boy that knocks down his Foe
Who e'er t'other gets up, demands One rising Blow;
Yet I knew a Young Rogue that thrown flat in ye field,
Wou'd as he lay under cry out, Sirrah Yield.
So the French, when Our Generalls soundly did pay 'em
Went Triumphant to Church & sang stoutly Te Deum.
So the famous Tom: Leigh when quite run a ground
Comes off by out laughing the Company round.
In evry Vile Pamphlet You'll read the same Fances,
Having thus overthrown all our Author Advances.
My Offers of Peace You ill understood
Friend Sheridan, When will You know Your own Good?
'Twas to Teach You in Modester Language Your Duty,
For Were You a Dog I cou'd not be rude to You.
As a Good quiet Soul who no Mischief intends
To a Quarrelsom Fellow cryes, Let us be friends
But we like Antæus and Hercules fight
The ofter You fall, the ofter You Write.
And I'll use You as he did that Overgrown Clown,
I'll first take you up, and then take You down;
And 'tis Your own case for You never can Wound
The worst Dunce in Your School; 'till he's heav'd from the Ground
I Beg Yr pardon for using my Left hand, but I was in great haste, and the other was Employ'd att the same time in writing some Letters of Business
Septbr: 20o 1718
This Letter was writt Backwards or with the Left hand.
